bug.author: HansHirse
bug.summary: Potential bug in cv::medianBlur() for large images in OpenCV 4.0.0
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>System information (version)</denchmark-h>
OpenCV => 4.0.0 (maybe 3.4.x for x > 0) Operating System / Platform => Windows 10, 64 Bit Compiler => Visual Studio 2017
<denchmark-h:h2>Detailed description</denchmark-h>
We encountered a problem with the cv::medianBlur() function for large images while switching from OpenCV 3.4.0 to OpenCV 4.0.0 lately. In OpenCV 3.4.0, cv::medianBlur() delivers reasonable results for small and large images. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692578/49787982-62a06c80-fd28-11e8-94c2-1c881fe79a33.png></denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692578/49787987-659b5d00-fd28-11e8-9a53-8f6cc23e09e3.png></denchmark-link>
In OpenCV 4.0.0, cv::medianBlur() generates severe artifacts for large images. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692578/49788197-fc681980-fd28-11e8-876e-a3460dfda7e7.png></denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692578/49788199-feca7380-fd28-11e8-8a6b-b6498dbb4a26.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Download this image <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692578/49787624-6f709080-fd27-11e8-8e27-9b34a9f6f8ec.png></denchmark-link>
Run cv::Mat img = cv::imread("img.png", cv::IMREAD_GRAYSCALE); cv::Mat imgLarge; cv::resize(img, imgLarge, cv::Size(2048, 2048)); cv::medianBlur(imgLarge, imgLarge, 9); Inspect the result, e.g. using the Image Watch extension in Visual Studio or cv::imshow(). <denchmark-h:h2>Wild guess</denchmark-h>
We had a brief look at the source code differences between the aforementioned OpenCV versions with respect to the cv::medianBlur() function. It seems, that there have been a lot of changes in the internal medianBlur_8u_O1() function, whereas the internal medianBlur_8u_Om() function seems to be untouched. Therefore, we copied the internal medianBlur_8u_Om() implementation into our code and ran it directly. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692578/49788875-ccba1100-fd2a-11e8-9b14-9cb1c4c27ae6.png></denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692578/49788878-cdeb3e00-fd2a-11e8-86c6-92e91ad01413.png></denchmark-link>
We assume, that the internal medianBlur_8u_Om() implementation is used for small images, hence the cv::medianBlur() function still works for these. So, finally, our wild guess is, that some errors might have been introduced into in the internal medianBlur_8u_O1() implementation during the recent modifications. Unfortunately, we don't have resources to further investigate this issue on our own, but hopefully, we could provide a clue into the right direction.
